document.title: DYNAMIC LEARNING MAPS ESSENTIAL ELEMENTS FOR English Language Arts

C228E05C8E0C4F7FAC268BC1BAB22AC3.description:
Use general academic and domain-specific
words and phrases across contexts.

1011DB9640264ADF853841FAC7C10894.description:
Interpret simple figures of speech encountered while
reading or listening.

2359586B1A604E31B731E1DDA4AEF8DD.description:
Demonstrate understanding of word
relationships and use.

2D2C64DD9E5B4C31A6BE01E04A9AACDC.description:
Consult reference materials (dictionaries, online
vocabulary supports) to clarify the meaning of unfamiliar
words encountered when reading.

BA3E4BCAF9F449AF82E1A4B1DD9F625A.description:
Identify and use root words and the words that result
when affixes are added or removed.

D4DC1E3143F2466888E7E1F6136F7FF4.description:
Use context to determine the meaning of unknown
words.

F5DA25FFF8EE4F319B6EF951BC5E3144.description:
Vary sentence structure using a variety of simple and
compound sentence structures.

DC370E02C51646DE8A2C8A83C6417A53.description:
Use language to achieve desired outcomes
when communicating.

572BC290006B495F8EACAE30F7AE03DB.description:
Spell most single-syllable words correctly and apply
knowledge of word chunks in spelling longer words.

CAE806EC7EB34265BB00FD48310516DE.description:
Demonstrate conventions of standard English including
capitalization, ending punctuation, and spelling when
writing.

B03D08B2FFD046A4AD84196CD6D98369.description:
Demonstrate understanding of conventions
of standard English.

22733AC811494AFCB9AA314FB160F850.description:
Use digital, electronic, and other resources and tools to
improve uses of language as needed.

D98A3A23CFA4494C94305A25E4ADABA3.description: Use conventions of standard English when needed.

69290C7E955747D48DDF3AAC74F3AA6F.description:
Demonstrate standard English grammar
and usage when communicating.

53BF55ABE47542BB95966447AC61E83B.description:
Adapt communication to a variety of
contexts and tasks using complete sentences when indicated
or appropriate.

830F20B1DAE6410AAA92F2DE793EFA42.description:
Use digital media strategically (e.g.,
textual, graphical, audio, visual, and interactive elements) in
presentations to support understanding and add interest.

2F20A0D5C8114E5D9562F20B67C64F0D.description:
Present an argument on a topic using an
organization appropriate to the purpose, audience, and task.

29099F1A53E6454183D0509814CFA1DC.description:
Determine whether the claims and
reasoning enhance the speaker’s argument on a topic.

B0E481DDAEDE4FA5A50A9F30787E530F.description:
Determine the credibility and accuracy of
information presented across diverse media or formats.

B7A7A719768E46D0A76BAA546EDFA51F.description:
Respond to agreements and disagreements in a
discussion.

704566EF6F6B46CDB97C0D5DC1B47B89.description:
Ask and answer questions to verify or clarify own ideas
and understandings during a discussion.

585536E3F5F24AE387D42A9AEB100018.description: Work with peers to set rules and goals for discussions.

A511B1CCB7DD4F9B934D152DDE554C56.description:
Prepare for discussions by collecting information on the
topic.

E69236583BDB4BDD841DFA76F7CCEC92.description:
Write routinely over extended time frames
(time for research, reflection, and revision) for a range of tasks,
purposes, and audiences.

EDE4D181B9D34F57AA2D5801F6B61FFA.description:
Apply Grades 11-12 Essential Elements for Reading
Standards to informational texts (e.g., “Compare and
contrast reasoning and arguments used in one's work
with those used in seminal U.S. texts.”).

0B89594BB5624EE9A8718E360EA55C4C.description:
Apply Grades 11-12 Essential Elements for Reading
Standards to literature (e.g., “Compare and contrast
elements of American literature to other literary works,
self, or one’s world. [Compare themes, topics,
locations, context, and point of view].”).

72605E26FE38468FA3652EBEC230CE83.description:
Cite evidence from literary or informational
texts.

156F70CAF1A249EDAFD8323925DD0E8F.description:
Write answers to research questions by
selecting relevant information from multiple resources.

EA499997FDB141349E76C0762B334CD8.description:
Conduct research projects to answer
questions posed by self and others using multiple sources of
information.

2403DC203C194402B97301C9B4AD8669.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

3D633D5B5A9049AE8E1CFFCB52771A05.description:
Use technology, including the Internet, to
produce, publish and update an individual or shared writing
project.

21254F51D4F646C3BFBCCF6FA22E11D3.description:
Develop and strengthen writing as needed
by planning, revising, editing, and rewriting.

B862523E911246C19F04107D5BB9D0D4.description:
Produce writing that is appropriate to a
particular task, purpose, and audience.

561EC58084334763B19623B28AD33392.description:
Use descriptive words and phrases to convey a vivid
picture of experiences, events, setting, or characters.

1C0E3D6AB37D4CED82704CF7BE865AAB.description:
Organize the events in the narrative using temporal
words to signal order and add cohesion.

AC4670C0FFD747C880C674C11681E80A.description:
Write a narrative about a problem, situation, or
observation including at least one character, details, and
clearly sequenced events.

048A00C5185041E2B326A49C82F2A85F.description:
Write about events or personal
experiences.

A3CC7778AE204BB396C52000D801C4D3.description: Provide a closing or concluding statement.

DF6DF464C18E47B1B17B3933FD205782.description:
Use domain specific vocabulary when writing claims
related to a topic of study or text.

5440524D5BEE4653B5260077BE649C80.description:
Use complete, simple sentences, as well as compound
and other complex sentences as appropriate.

4873EDA9DE774FE7B54393429CBBAD8C.description: Develop the topic with relevant facts, details, or quotes.

1D6E2718AB854BC883014495E6C757D9.description:
Introduce a topic clearly and write an informative or
explanatory text that conveys ideas, concepts, and
information including visual, tactual, or multimedia
information as appropriate.

4FABCACDAA2340478A370B4B0510E2D5.description:
Write to share information supported by
details.

3FD594A8698F48049D2E6D5F523CD681.description:
Support claims with reasons and evidence drawn from
text.

39CEFF6FCCAA450FA4950067E559BC5B.description:
Write an argument to support a claim that results from
studying a topic or reading a text.

8FD6CE676251499B9B2D53FB31674E6E.description:
Demonstrate understanding while actively
engaged in reading or listening to literary non-fiction.

3DEC518F54AA48C9BC92973575BA9AC5.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

4944D02119214802AD5CE06EB2F7E631.description:
Compare and contrast arguments made by
two different texts on the same topic.

C7024E9C051A4DEF99CAB8B14B5F5C5F.description:
Determine whether the claims and
reasoning enhance the author’s argument in an informational
text.

29E5D54E50FC4C1CBDBF107EB12A63B1.description:
Analyze information presented in different
media on related topics to answer questions or solve problems.

98E0EF9D07E34A44A2E824C88C72836A.description:
Determine author’s point of view and
compare and contrast it with own point of view.

36D7A6B5E9074FBCABC9D01A891C51FE.description:
Determine whether the structure of a text
enhances an author’s claim.

F88C9B34B2E34C94AFA3D8D79F56D573.description:
Determine how words or phrases in a text,
including words with multiple meanings and figurative
language, impacts the meaning of the text.

EF6DFBB0838C4E499A7A6958D0B20D6A.description:
Determine how individuals, ideas, or
events change over the course of the text.

E7400056A4D5437592DC44ED10D9B4B4.description:
Determine the central idea of a text;
recount the text.

6DDEA416D6564F8B84E03632EC3E05B9.description:
Analyze a text to determine its meaning
and cite textual evidence to support explicit and implicit
understanding.

92858208D0AB4688B3B6BEB8891FA455.description:
Demonstrate understanding while
actively engaged in reading or listening to stories, dramas, and
poems.

34C5C4F4FDDF4C638D9DDD42556BE1DB.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

E71A40648B484E5C841438494C8E121A.description:
Demonstrate explicit understanding of
recounted versions of foundational works of American
literature.

DF0A0CCA072A4697B2E2B9A4E9986F39.description:
Compare two or more interpretations (e.g.,
recorded or live production of a play or recorded novel or
poetry) of a story, drama, or poem.

079C969F33C34DB3BA144D03E21DB97D.description:
Determine the point of view when there is
a difference between the author’s actual language and
intended meaning.

2279DB0FBCB34552B0167E5FD249FBB9.description:
Determine how the author’s choice of
where to end the story contributes to the meaning.

559C98AEECA34B959EAFE37E4B6B890E.description:
Determine how words or phrases in a text,
including words with multiple meanings and figurative
language, impact the meaning.

1E7ACBB925BD4A04BBCCC3B1B4A8B5CD.description:
Determine how characters, the setting or
events change over the course of the story or drama.

73FFDB6F40B545F0AF72A552404FC9AD.description:
Recount the main events of the text which
are related to the theme or central idea.

8EC60DE758F14216AFED818F25842268.description:
Analyze a text to determine its meaning
and cite textual evidence to support explicit and implicit
understandings.
